project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Education for All-Fast Track Initiative: Support to the Education Project for Cameroon is to reduce class sizes by recruiting and retaining more teachers in the public education system, as well as deploying them in an equitable manner. The project consists of one component.  It will be fully used to support the Government's contract teacher program. It will contribute to the payment of the salaries of 37,200 primary public school contract teachers recruited during FY07, FY08, FY09 and FY10 during: (a) the period from January 2010 through the date which is four months after the effective date, and (b) part of the remainder of the 2010 and 2011 school year. The indicators for this project will be the reduction in pupil-teacher ratios (PTR) and reduction in the variation of PTR across regions. PTRs are measured by dividing the number of teachers by the number of students within regions and for the nation. The variation of PTR is calculated by a regressing the size of specific schools against the number of teachers in each specific school.
